Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture of a land habitat, like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw a picture of a water habitat, like a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include different types of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include different types of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can show the different living things in each habitat and how they compare to each other.
The student can use their drawings to explain patterns they see in plant and animal diversity in different habitats.
